first_translate: I can’t believe...

hangle: 괜히 북쪽 산맥의 마물들을 지배하는 놈이 아니야.
first_translate: no wonder he’s  known as the one that rules over all the monsters on these mountains.

hangle: 여태 상대한 놈 중 가장 성가셨어…
first_translate: that was by far my most annoying opponent yet...
it felt like I almost died back there.
siegren.
good work out there today.

hangle: 마물의 수장 중 하나를 죽인 기분이 어떠냐.
first_translate: how does it feel to have killed one of the leaders among those beasts?
not bad, I guess.

hangle: 수도로 돌아가려면, 정식적인 황자로 임명받아야 한다.
first_translate: in order for me to return home, I must first become prince again.

hangle: 그러기 위해 필요한 건 그럴듯한 공적.
first_translate: and what I need to do so is some sort of achievement.
that's why I did it.
but I don’t really feel any sense of satisfaction from doing so.
still... now I’ll finally get to go back home.
to where mother’s killers are waiting.
and also...
where fiona is--

hangle: 그 녀석이 아직도 수도에 붙어있는지 모르겠군요.
first_translate: I’m not even sure if she’s still at the capital anymore.

hangle: 남의 속도 모르고 관광이나 해야겠다고 종알거렸는데.
first_translate: all she said before leaving was something about how she wanted to travel around because people didn’t understand her.
don’t worry about that.
for my poor student’s sake,
I’ve prepared him a final weapon inside his manor.
now then, let’s check up on our soldiers.
huh...?

hangle: 대체 어떻게 피오나를 붙잡아 놓는다는 걸까.
first_translate: just how exactly am I supposed to keep fiona here?
she’s just too...
elusive.
siegren.

hangle: 난 너에게 상처 주지 않을 거야.
first_translate: I promise you won’t ever get hurt.
and someday,

hangle: 분명 아주 많은 것을 가지게 될 거야.
first_translate: you’re going to gain everything your heart desires.
after saying that, she left.
fiona.

hangle: 내가 지금까지 가지고 싶다고 생각한 건
first_translate: the only thing I want right now...
...is revenge.

hangle: 그 한 가지를 위해서 아주 많은 것들이 필요하게 되었지만.
first_translate: even though I may end up losing many things along the way.
a dragon’s heart would bring me great honor.
wait for me,
fiona.
wait for me.
wow...
this is house haylon’s manor in the capital city?

hangle: 마왕성 같았던 헤일론 성보다 훨씬 세련되었네.
first_translate: it looks much more refined than their castle, which looked like a demon king’s lair.
the outer walls and training grounds look well-maintained,
and flowers suitable for this season were planted in the garden.

hangle: 외관만 봤을 땐 잘 관리되고 있는 것 같아….
first_translate: from the outside, it seems like they take good care of themselves...

hangle: 마음 같아선 정원사를 칭찬해 주고 싶을 정도인데…
first_translate: if anything, I’d love to compliment whoever takes care of the gardens...

hangle: 그 사람들이 보기엔 난 윗선에서 내려온 감시자겠지.
first_translate: as far as everyone else knows, I came here as duke abel’s subordinate.
they probably think I'm here to spy on them.
I doubt anyone wants me here.

hangle: 나도 불편한 장소에 오래 있을 생각은 없으니,
first_translate: I don’t plan on being here long either,
so I might as well finish what I came here to do quickly.
I told the gatekeeper why I was here,
so I bet the news has already spread throughout the manor.
welcome,
lady fiona.
my name is selin, and I manage this estate.
I've heard quite a lot about you from lord abel.
welcome, lady fiona.

hangle: 헤일론 저택에 오신 것을 진심으로 환영합니다.
first_translate: on behalf of everyone working here, we welcome you to house haylon’s manor.
welcome,
lady fiona!
uh...
what’s all this?!

hangle: 보통 귀족가라도 이렇게 성대하게 환영해주진 않는데.
first_translate: normally, nobles wouldn’t greet guests this extravagantly.
must you be exhausted after traveling such a distance?
your room has been prepared for you.

hangle: 원하시는 식사가 있다면 얼마든지 말씀해 주세요.
first_translate: let us know if there’s anything specific you'd like to eat.
it all tastes delicious.

hangle: 역시 인간이란 먹기 위해 사는 게 틀림없어.
first_translate: people definitely live to eat.

hangle: 내가 좋아하는 음식이 뭔지 어떻게 안 걸까?
first_translate: how did they find out what foods I liked?
wait, but more importantly...
I had come here for a reason.
selin.

hangle: 저는 아벨의 명에 따라 이 저택을 둘러보러 왔는데요.
first_translate: duke abel ordered me to inspect this place while I stayed here.
of course! we'll show you around immediately after dinner.
of course! we'll show you around immediately after dinner.

hangle: ―해서 여기까지 저택의 주요 장소는 안내를 마쳤습니다.
first_translate: with that, we conclude showing you around the main areas of the manor.
next...
ah,
would you perhaps like to see the ledgers?
thank you very much.
this is thick.
there are plenty more books, so please allow me to fetch them for you.
at least they seem friendly enough...

hangle: 사람을 겉만 보고 판단할 수는 없어.
first_translate: but you shouldn’t judge a book by its cover.
while thinking that, I decided to read through each page carefully.
I haven’t found any signs of double-entry accounting yet...
or maybe I missed it.

hangle: 가장 쉽게 일어날 수 있는 일이 바로 횡령이다 보니,
first_translate: embezzlement happens easily when dealing with money,
which makes it difficult to overlook...
these records are extremely detailed!

hangle: 전부 보는 데만 몇 달이 걸릴지도 몰라!
first_translate: it could take months to read through every single entry!
isn’t this...

hangle: 장부 보기 싫어서 날 보낸 거 아냐?!?
first_translate: why abel sent me here instead of coming himself?!?
looks like he’ll be stuck here for a bit longer.
well since I’m here anyway,
I might as well hurry up and finish reading!!!
that’s what I thought,
but...
why did it turn into this mess?!?!??!!?!!!
